title: High Ping from northern Canada (600+)
body:
My Friend moved to Northern canada and has limited internet options. He's got 5mbps DL but is the ping here entirely due to distance or can anything help? Thanks!

Tracing route to 104.160.131.3 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.12.1
  2     7 ms     7 ms     7 ms  d76-9-40-254.vu.northwestel.net [76.9.40.254]
  3     8 ms     8 ms     7 ms  216.126.108.65
  4     8 ms     9 ms     8 ms  192.168.0.209
  5   560 ms   556 ms   557 ms  192.168.0.129
  6   561 ms   574 ms   556 ms  192.168.0.194
  7   560 ms   557 ms   569 ms  67.69.228.13
  8   583 ms   563 ms   591 ms  tcore4-torontoxn_bundle-ether6.net.bell.ca [64.2
30.97.164]
  9   567 ms   572 ms   562 ms  tcore4-toronto63_hundredgige1-1-0-0.net.bell.ca
[64.230.50.14]
 10   561 ms   594 ms   574 ms  dis67-toronto63_10-0-0.net.bell.ca [64.230.106.1
03]
 11   568 ms   576 ms   569 ms  207.35.49.162
 12   578 ms   567 ms   569 ms  104.160.131.37
 13   572 ms   567 ms   604 ms  104.160.131.3

Trace complete.

replies.body:
This line here 

> 5 560 ms 556 ms 557 ms 192.168.0.129

looks pretty troubling to me. It seems like something is probably not working 100% on that node, and it's going to be something he'll need to speak with his ISP in order to sort out sadly =(
Turns out he goes from Iqaluit to Yellowknife from Satellite and that's where the issue is happening. Thanks all!
Ping isn’t based on speed so much as it is type of service - is his internet provided through land connections, or through satelite?

I know it’s not the best link but [here’s](https://www.skycasters.com/satellite-internet-service-specs/system-latency/) a general explanation. If you search “why is latency so high on satellite internet” you’ll find more physics based explanations. TLDR is that the physics and technology involved simply cannot support low latency connections.

i checked and it says "wired last mile"

im assuming the issue is distance but didnt know of the trace showed anything else

The issue isn’t how long the wires are. **Any** wired connection, even one that crosses the ocean, can support a sub-200 ping or so. The fact that his connection goes through a satellite instantly makes that latency shoot up quite a lot.
Thanks for all your communications btw! says here they are wired: https://support.nwtel.ca/hc/en-us/articles/208157643

Well, it says “wired last mile” - upon my research I’m seeing hints that *some* but not nearly all of their service area is *fully* wired. That being said, I can’t say for certain - the amount of ping here is heavily suggesting that his internet is not fully wired (but may go through a wire from Riot-ISP-satellite-ISP base near town-wire-house).

It’d probably be best for him to go ahead and contact his ISP and inquire about this ping and whether it’s expected or not.
